page.title: 05Farming
page.content: {Arable Farming}is the main activity on the land in this area. The main crops grown are wheat, barley, oats, rye and oil-seed-rape.Root crops such as potato and sugar-beet are also popular.Within the area the type of soil varies considerably. In some parts the soil is heavy and requires draining;in other places it is light and sandy. {Mixed Farming}usually combines livestock with growing crops for feeding the cattle.One farm has Fresian Cattle and grows silage, sugar beet (the beet tops being animal fodder) and other arable crops. {Intensive farming}is carried out at nurseries where many different plants are grown under glass. Intensive cultivation also includes salad production and flowers.There are also market gardens and small holdings.
